item.title: Understanding Logistic Regression (1)_Odds and Logit Transformation
item.description: #Introduction I have summarized what I learned about odds and logit transformation, which are prerequisites for understanding logistic regression. ##reference In understanding the odds and logit conversion, I have referred to the following. Logistic regression analysis (5) â”€ Inverse of logistic transformation Understanding Statistical Analysis-Overview of Logistic Regression Analysis- (StatQuest: Logistic Regression ](https://youtu.be/yIYKR4sgzI8) (StatQuest: Odds and Log(Odds), Clearly Explained!!! ](https://youtu.be/ARfXDSkQf1Y) #Logistic regression Logistic regression overview Logistic regression is an algorithm often used to estimate the probability that a given data will belong to a particular class.

item.title: [Machine learning] Understand logistic regression from both scikit-learn and mathematics
item.description: #1. Purpose If you want to do machine learning, anyone can use scikit-learn etc. to implement it relatively easily. However, in order to achieve results at work or to improve your level, The explanation “I don’t really understand the background, but I got this result” is clearly weak. In this article, the two aims are to “use the scikit-learn first because the theory is good” and to “understand the background from mathematics” from the fourth and later.

item.title: Machine learning with Pokemon
item.description: ## Introduction The Pokemon Sword Shield was launched last month. By the way, have you ever played Pokemon? As anyone who has played Pokemon will know, Pokemon has the ability value which consists of HP, Kogeki, Bogyo, Tokukou, Tokubo, and Quickness. It can be said that the higher the ability value is, the stronger the Pokemon is. Ability score is calculated from three values: race value, individual value and effort value.
